title: Redesign the entrance overlay to be very cute (keep headline text)

requirements.text: Redesign the entire entrance overlay screen to look and feel “very cute” while keeping the underlying love-letter page (content + layout) unchanged once the overlay dismisses.

quotes: Change the entrence and make it very cute

acceptanceCriteria: On initial load, users see a newly redesigned entrance overlay (not just minor tweaks) that clearly reads as “very cute”.
After the reveal completes, the existing love-letter page appears with the same layout and content as before.

requirements.text: Keep the entrance overlay headline text exactly as: "my Feelings for you" and keep the headline color pinkish (avoid red for the headline).

quotes: Keep the current headline “my Feelings for you,”

acceptanceCriteria: The entrance headline text is exactly "my Feelings for you" (same casing and spacing).
The headline color is pinkish and not red.

requirements.text: Ensure the redesigned cute entrance overlay remains fully activatable via tap/click and keyboard (Enter/Space) and dismisses via a short reveal sequence of approximately 1 second, calling the existing completion callback only after the reveal animation finishes (with a fallback timer if animation/transition end events do not fire).

quotes: Implement a tap/click/keyboard (Enter/Space) activation on the new greeting-card entrance that plays a short (~1 second) reveal animation and then dismisses the overlay, reliably calling the existing completion callback only after the animation finishes (with a fallback timer if animation events do not fire).

acceptanceCriteria: Click/tap on the overlay triggers the reveal and dismiss sequence.
Pressing Enter or Space while the overlay is focused triggers the reveal and dismiss sequence.
`onComplete` is invoked only after the reveal animation completes; a fallback timer prevents getting stuck if animation events do not fire.

requirements.text: Preserve accessibility behavior for the redesigned cute entrance: when `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce` is enabled, avoid the motion-heavy reveal sequence and instead dismiss the overlay near-immediately while keeping all entrance user-facing text in English.

quotes: Use English for any user-facing text in the build request.

Preserve accessibility behavior for the new entrance: when the user has prefers-reduced-motion enabled, avoid the animated reveal sequence and instead perform a near-immediate reveal while keeping all entrance user-facing text in English.

acceptanceCriteria: With `prefers-reduced-motion: reduce`, activating the overlay dismisses it near-immediately (no long animation).
All entrance text shown to the user remains in English.

constraints: Do not modify any frontend immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not add new backend canisters/services or external integrations; keep this change frontend-only.
Keep all user-facing text in English.
nonGoals: Do not change the love-letter page body content (message, quote, gallery, share-link section, footer signature).
Do not change backend logic (Motoko actor remains unchanged).
Do not introduce authentication, payments, real-time features, or any unrelated product features.
